channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Your Portfolio Should Include Scarce Assets
item.description: Portfolios that include both productive and scarce assets can deliver similar performance to the S&P 500 with less risk than those that hold only productive assets.

item.title: Target's Pride Month presence will be subdued in 2024 after last year's protests
item.description: Company says it will carry merchandise only in “select stores”.

item.title: Coiled Tight: Smaller Companies Are Primed for Outperformance
item.description: Small-cap companies are poised for a rebound. The sector is best approached through an active investment strategy where expertise and a deep understanding of the individual businesses and their risk-and-reward characteristics are necessary for success.

item.title: Bumble founder says your dating 'AI concierge' will soon date hundreds of other people's 'concierges' for you
item.description: Bumble is now navigating itself in a world of AI—which means rethinking how humans will interact with each other in an increasing age of chatbots.

item.title: Investment Returns Are NOT Random
item.description: Are investment returns random across time as Burton Malkiel suggests in his book, A Random Walk Down Wall Street? There is notable disagreement on this topic. This research finds that practitioners may need to rethink their portfolio optimization routines.

item.title: BYD plots to overtake Tesla in Europe by 2030
item.description: BYD's Europe managing director plans to get around looming tariffs by building the ultra-cheap EVs on the continent.

item.title: Generational Wealth: Does the Apple Fall Far From the Tree?
item.description: There is strong evidence that most “rich families” will be poorer after several generations. Some of the reasons for this are systemic like taxes. But most factors that diminish a family’s wealth over generations are the choices that heirs make.

item.title: Why a $3 billion software firm is betting on a flexible-work future—'the focus for us is carrot, not stick'
item.description: Sarah Franklin, a 15-year Salesforce alum, helms Lattice with the best of her former boss’ flexibility practices close at hand.

item.title: State Capitalism in Private Markets: Mission Creep
item.description: Governments relish mingling in markets. Yet, if past policies are any guide, taxpayers are being shortchanged.

item.title: Upgrade OneCard: An All-Hassle Rewards Card
item.description: The Upgrade OneCard offers great rewards, but you have to jump through a lot of hoops to get them.
